title: [aerospace] Concentration Risk in Baggage Handling
description: All baggage handling records show a single bag type ('CHECKED') and a single scan status ('SCANNED'), indicating a lack of diversity in baggage handling processes which could lead to operational bottlenecks.
recommendations: Introduce additional bag types for efficiency
business_impact: Enhancing baggage handling diversity can improve throughput and reduce delays.

title: [aerospace] Employee Distribution Across Departments
description: The majority of employees are concentrated in the 'OPERATIONS' department (14 employees), while 'MAINTENANCE' and 'GROUND_HANDLING' have fewer employees. This could lead to operational strain in critical areas.
recommendations: Assess staffing needs in maintenance and ground handling
business_impact: Balanced staffing can improve operational efficiency and reduce burnout.

title: [aerospace] Frequent Minimal Delays by Specific Carriers
description: The majority of delays are categorized as 'MINIMAL' (23 occurrences), particularly with carrier 'KAL'. This could indicate a pattern of operational issues that need addressing.
recommendations: Implement targeted training for operational staff
business_impact: Addressing these delays can enhance operational reliability and customer trust.
